p: Brown et al. reported that a subset of contemporary EV-D68 strains, including isolates from the 2014 outbreak, could infect and replicate in neuroblastoma-derived neuronal cell line SH-SY5Y, and neurotropism was also observed in the primary human neuron cultures and a mouse paralysis model [ 63]. By constructing chimeras at the capsid-level of EV-D68, Royston et al. found it exhibit tropism in respiratory, intestinal, and neural tissues [ 64]. These in vitro results indicate the EV-D68 neural tropism and signatures of neurovirulence biologically, which provide useful information for the pathogenesis of EV-D68 and its possible associations with AFM.
